Access to a meaningful counsel is not supposed to be a privilege for only the wealthy few. In fact, it is a fundamental constitutional right guaranteed to anyone facing jail or prison as a result of a criminal conviction.

It is the duty of the State of Oregon to ensure that all people, including underprivileged people, have a competent and zealous advocate when the state brings a case against them. However, hampered by funding limitations and budget allocations, Oregon is often failing to meet even the absolute minimum demands of the Constitution as it pertains to the Sixth Amendmentâ€™s guarantee of effective counsel.

TAKE ACTION: Tell your legislators you support HB 3145.

Innocent or guilty, rich or poor, you have the right to a qualified and engaged counsel. If the state wants to deprive someone of their liberty, they must be required to prove their case beyond a reasonable doubt. And it is the public defender who must stand in the gap on behalf of those charged with crimes — all of whom are innocent until proven guilty — to ensure that the government meets its burden.

ACT NOW: Ask your Oregon legislators to fund and support HB 3145.
